subject: Re: [junit] Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: ... The demo on the web is something of a toy to show how JUnit Factory works. To get the full experience, you should install the plug-in for Eclipse which has
messageBody:
On 1/13/07, saldin samuel <saldin_s@...> wrote:
> Hi Kevin,
>
> I have just gone through the demo and it is impressive
> with the parameters of primitive data types such as
> int, String, etc. How about generating the unit tests
> for Objects such as class instances ?
>

The demo on the web is something of a toy to show how JUnit Factory
works. To get the full experience, you should install the plug-in for
Eclipse which has none of the limitations of the one-class-at-a-time
web demo. You can upload and generate tests for entire projects. In
fact, we use it to generate tests for JUnit Factory and the underlying
engine - the Agitator - itself.

We publish the results at:
http://www.agitar.com/openquality/dashboard-db/index.html

> For instance, if my method is:
>
> public Student getFirstStudent(School school)
> {
> }

We certainly can generate tests for methods like this. Download the
plug-in for Eclipse and give it a try. I can send you an invitation if
you'd like.

Kevin
www.junitfactory.com
You send us code. We send you tests. For free.
